intro: Mikania yapasensis, commonly known as the Yapas Mikania, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring opposite, heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it can become invasive in certain areas.
